cant ... wait.. dieing..

URF 2014 was a blast.
In 2015 it was too tame for some reason. I just didn't have that whole "omg this is so Crazy"-feeling.

So if its going to be like 2014 again then sure. Otherwise I'm not interested.
But literally the only they did different between the two was remove the damage resistance against dinosaurs, and ramp up the health and damage numbers into the thousands.
I know and I don't really understand it myself. It was just my personal experience.

I have to admit that 2014 URF was far more fun than 2015 URF. What really ruined it for me though were the people whom were acting as if it were a ranked match and becoming toxic if they were losing.

The entire point to URF mode was for it to be a sh@ts and giggles mode to have fun in, kinda like memes&games.
MEMES AND GAMES IS A DEAD SERIOUS ENVIRONMENT NO JOKES ALLOWED.
http://m5.paperblog.com/i/90/905798/edward-snowden-is-a-goddamn-hero-L-lKJEWt.jpeg

2014 URF was completely unexpected. People knew what to expect for 2015. They knew (most) of who was good and who wasn't. And as is the case for almost every random game mode, people started taking it too seriously. IF you weren't picking one of the OP champs, then what was even then point?!

But it is the problem the mode runs into. Some champions are just so broken on it that you can't go against them unless you're also one of the broken champions. So the pool of "viable" champions shrinks really small really quickly. I'd have to imagine this was the biggest change between first and second years. The ability to try out new stuff died much faster.

Well thats certainly true. But the problem were also the truly broken champs, which were either urf-sized or disabled from the beginning. In 2014 you still had to face those champs, and even if you lost it was kinda funny to watch. Then they got disabled after a few days and that was good too, because we had to move on.

Perhaps that's the trick. They should just randomly disable a few champs everyday so people are forced to pick something else up.
